Class MinesweeperView

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
MinesweeperView
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.Observer
public class MinesweeperView
extends javafx.application.Application
implements java.util.Observer
This class defines the View for the Minesweeper package.
Author:
kylesmith, brendanp, matthewgleason, austinhillis6, cdpeterson

  • Constructor Details

    • MinesweeperView

      public MinesweeperView()

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start​(javafx.stage.Stage stage) throws java.lang.Exception
      This method controls the GUI View (in MVC) for the Minesweeper program. This method presents the user with a Welcome screen, where they can open a new game, load a previous game or play the survival mode.
      Specified by:
      start in class javafx.application.Application
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • createSurvival

      private void createSurvival​(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      This private method initiates a survival-style game, where the difficultly increases with each completed level. This method is initiated by a button click on the Welcome screen.
      Parameters:
      stage - the stage to create the survival game on

    • selectSize

      private void selectSize​(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      This private method changes the stage to display three size options: small, medium, and large. Once a size is selected, the user is then prompted for the difficulty by selectDiff.
      Parameters:
      stage - the stage to prompt the user for size on

    • selectDiff

      private void selectDiff​(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      This private method changes the stage to display three difficulty options: easy, medium, and hard. This choice impacts the number of mines generated per board.
      Parameters:
      stage - the stage to prompt the user for difficulty on

    • createGame

      private void createGame​(javafx.stage.Stage stage, boolean newGameBool)
      This private method initiates the game, first by drawing the board, then by adding the event handlers for the game logic. This method also handles the Wow Factor feature, Survival Mode.
      Parameters:
      stage - the stage to draw the board onto
      newGameBool - whether the game should be new or load from a save file.

    • getIndexFromPosition

      private int getIndexFromPosition​(double position)
      This private method takes a position on screen, and converts it to its associated index in the mine board. This method handles both X and Y coordinates since the board is square.
      Parameters:
      position - the location in the window of a mouse click
      Returns:
      the associated index

    • update

      public void update​(java.util.Observable o, java.lang.Object arg)
      This public method implements the update method of the Observer interface. This method is called by the model after this object has been added as an observer. This method redraws the board based on changes made to the underlying model.
      Specified by:
      update in interface java.util.Observer

    • win

      private void win()
      This private method displays an alert in the case that the player wins at the end of the game.

    • lose

      private void lose()
      This private method displays an alert in the case that the player loses at the end of the game.

    • showScoreBoard

      private void showScoreBoard()
      This private method displays a new Alert window with high scores. High scores are stored in the highScoreFile File field.
